pr_title: [1.16] Allow modders to add custom WaveMembers in Raids

timeline.bodyText: No imports in patches, and are you even using it?
timeline.author: DaemonUmbra
OrionDevelopment
OrionDevelopment

replies.bodyText: other classes that have this create method (eg: EntityClassification) dont have documentation either, in my opinion i dont see how this method would warrant documentation, however i will put some kind of documentation once i get back on my pc
replies.author: seymourimadeit

replies.bodyText: also if im not mistaken that method is already explained in the IExtensibleEnum class
replies.author: seymourimadeit

replies.bodyText:
Yes that might be so, but the point i am trying to make is that the int[] is completely undocumented.
I personally do not care if it is on the create method or somewhere else.
But since you are touching this, adding a single line of documentation is what I ask for. It simply helps other modders out when they want to add a raid member themselfs.
replies.author: OrionDevelopment

timeline.author: OrionDevelopment

replies.bodyText: i mean, this is a test mod, but i will fix it i guess once i get back on my pc
replies.author: seymourimadeit

timeline.message: hopefully fixed formatting in test mod
hopefully this fixes the npe error and build errors
added a bit of documentation to the int[] thing
hopefully fixed tabs in patch files
used spaces instead of tabs for test mod

replies.author: seymourimadeit

replies.bodyText:
You're including changes that you did not do.

  
    
      MinecraftForge/src/main/resources/META-INF/accesstransformer.cfg
    
    
         Line 272
      in
      6bb0c33
    
    
    
    

        
          
           protected-f net.minecraft.tags.NetworkTagManager field_199719_a # blocks 
        
    
  


See all those duplicate lines?
Also my bad, it's checkATs not checkSAS. It'll sort the ATs, make sure they are valid, remove duplicates, and propagate to children if needed.
Either way be sure to include only the changes you do.
replies.author: LexManos

replies.bodyText:
I think Lex meant checkAT
Edit: Wow was I late... thanks GH for not updating to show that Lex already corrected himself

timeline.bodyText: This class's code style is all kinda of messed up.... Have you looked at it? Honestly you could just skip this tho, as the IExtensibleEnable should explode if you did it wrong.
